contentList.content: Used to fuel psionic discipline powers or recreating spells within the psionic disciplines.
Psi Points
Used to fuel psionic discipline powers within the psionic disciplines only.
Psionic Mastery
Out of psi points
Resource for using spells through the Innate Psionics feature.
Innate Psionics
Psion are those who have tapped into a special otherworldly force, with the ability to actualize the power of their mind to accomplish impossible feats.
Psion
An Unleashed Mind's power is most often an innate force projected onto the world around them in the form of telekinesis.
Unleashed Mind
An Awakened Mind is a psion whose first power that manifests is telepathy, one of the most feared and shunned abilities.
Awakened Mind
A Transcended Mind tend to have the best grasp of their powers, seeing the place of their mind and how it ties into everything in the form of enlightenment.
Transcended Mind
A Shaper is a psion that specializes in the materialization of their imagination, projecting it out into the world.
Shaper's Mind
A Wandering Mind is a psion that tends toward curious and chaotic, unbounded and hard to pin down, and are natural wanderers in mind and body.
Wandering Mind
An Elemental Mind psion carries a psionic link to a primal power, some have a link to a particular element while others find all elements within their mind, raging an eternal war.
Elemental Mind

A Consuming Mind belongs to a dangerous branch of psionics that are born from the ability to sap energy from other creatures, tearing from them their thoughts, their mind, and ultimately their vitality for your own consumption.
Consuming Mind
A Knowing Mind is a psion that grasps that future as intuitively as the present, weaving together strings of casualty and fate in ways that would shatter the mind of a lesser mortal.
Knowing Mind
An Empathic Mind is a being whose strength is channeled through the heart and emotions rather than through the mind as typical for psions.
Empathic Mind
A scholarly user of psionics capable of manipulating the structures of reality.
Psion
Telekinesis Discipline

Gain access to the Telekinesis discipline abilities: passive feature, Telekinetic Hand, allowing you to manipulate objects in the area, the psionic power, Telekinetic Force and associated spells if you do not gain the discipline through the Psionic Adept feat.
Telekinetically retrieve an item or move an item to another location within [2] that weighs up to [1] lbs.
Telekinetic Hands
Telekinetically retrieve an item.
Telekinetic Hands: Retrieve
Telekinetically move an item to another location.
Telekinetic Hands: Move
Smash a creature or object with your mental power, possibly moving them backwards or forwards [2] or knocking them prone.
Telekinetic Force
Toggle between the option to push, pull or knock the target prone using Telekinetic Force options.
Telekinetic Force: Push
Telekinetic Force has been set to push the target backwards.
Telekinetic Force: Pull
Telekinetic Force has been set to pull the target forwards.
Telekinetic Force: Prone
Telekinetic Force has been set to knock the target prone.
Psychokinetics Discipline

Gain access to the Psychokinetics discipline abilities: passive feature, Energy Manipulation, allows you to manipulate energy in minor ways at will, the psionic power, Elemental Blast and associated spells if you do not gain the discipline through the Psionic Adept feat.
Elemental Blast Options
Toggle to set Elemental Blast to deal Fire, Cold, Lightning or Force damage. Abilities related to Elemental Blast also require this.
Fire Element
Focued on the element of fire, taking on the element's characteristics or dealing fire damage for certain abilities.
Cold Element
Focued on the element of ice, taking on the element's characteristics or dealing cold damage for certain abilities.
Lightning Element
Focued on the element of lightning, taking on the element's characteristics or dealing lightning damage for certain abilities.
Force Element
Focued on the element of force, taking on the element's characteristics or dealing force damage for certain abilities.
Energy Manipulation
Manipulate energy in minor ways through touch.
Energy Manipulation: Light
Manipulate energy to generate light on an object you touch.
Energy Manipulation: Fire
Manipulate energy to ignite objects.
Energy Manipulation: Lightning
Manipulate energy to create small arcs of electricity, electrifying surfaces or clouds.
Energy Manipulation: Ice
Manipulate energy to freeze or thaw liquid surfaces.
Enhancing Skill
Enhancing Surge
Enhancing Surge
Empower the body of a creature, granting them [1] and causing their next attack to deal an additional 1d6 damage.
Gain [1].
Deal an additional [1] on next attack.
Telekinetic Force Modifiers
Apply modifiers to Telekinetic Force.
Hammering
Expend Psi Points to add the Hammering modifier to Telekinetic Force, increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Hurling
Expend Psi Points to add the Hurling modifier to Telekinetic Force, allowing it to push or pull the target [1] per point spent.
Zone of
Expend Psi Points to add the Zone of modifier to Telekinetic Force, increasing its hit radius by [1] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Hammering Hurling
Expend Psi Points to add the Hammering and Hurling modifiers to Telekinetic Force, increasing its damage by an additional [1] and allowing it to push or pull the target [2] per point spent.
Hurling Zone

Expend Psi Points to add the Hurling and Zone of modifiers to Telekinetic Force, allowing it to push or pull the target [1] per point spent and increasing its hit radius by [1] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Zone of Hammering

Expend Psi Points to add the Zone of and Hammering modifiers to Telekinetic Force, increasing its hit radius by [2] which doubles per point spent after the first and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Crushing
Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing modifier to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target.
Hammering Hurling Zone of

Expend Psi Points to add the Hammering, Hurling and Zone of modifiers to Telekinetic Force, increasing its damage by an additional [1] and allowing it to push or pull the target [2] per point spent and increasing its hit radius by [2] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Crushing Hammering
Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing and Hammering modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Crushing Hurling
Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing and Hurling modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target and allowing it to push or pull the target [1] per point spent.
Crushing Zone of

Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing and Zone of modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target and increasing its hit radius by [1] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Crushing Hammering Hurling

Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing, Hammering and Hurling modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target, increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent and allowing it to push or pull the target [2] per point spent.
Crushing Hurling Zone of

Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing, Hurling and Zone of modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target, allowing it to push or pull the target [1] per point spent and increasing its hit radius by [1] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Crushing Zone of Hammering

Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing, Zone of and Hammering modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target, increasing its hit radius by [1] which doubles per point spent after the first and increasing its damage by an additional [2] per point spent.
Crushing Hammering Hurling Zone of

Expend Psi Points to add the Crushing, Hammering, Hurling and Zone of modifiers to Telekinetic Force, causing the power to Restrain the target, increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent, allowing it to push or pull the target [2] per point spent and increasing its hit radius by [2] which doubles per point spent after the first.
Elemental Blast Modifiers
Apply modifiers to Elemental Blast.
Amplified
Expend Psi Points to add the Amplified modifier to Elemental Blast, increasing its damage by 1d8 or 1d10 per point spent.
Lasting
Expend Psi Points to add the Lasting modifier to Elemental Blast, causing it to create a [1] radius of elemental surface based on the element.
Massive
Expend Psi Points to add the Massive modifier to Elemental Blast, unleashing the blast as a cone with an increasing range of [1] per point spent.
Overcharged

Expend Psi Points to add the Overcharged modifier to Elemental Blast, causing you to take [1] and removing your proficiency bonus from the power's attack or spell DC but increases the damage by twice your proficiency bonus.
Enhancing Surge Modifiers
Apply modifiers to Enhancing Surge.
Savage
Expend Psi Points to add the Savage modifier to Enhancing Surge, increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent.
Fortifying
Expend Psi Points to add the Fortifying modifier to Enhancing Surge, gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Swift
Expend Psi Points to add the Swift modifier to Enhancing Surge, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action.
Savage Fortifying
Expend Psi Points to add the Savage and Fortifying modifiers to Enhancing Surge, increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Resilient
Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient modifier to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage.
Swift Savage

Expend Psi Points to add the Swift and Savage modifiers to Enhancing Surge, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action and increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent.
Swift Fortifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Swift and Fortifying modifiers to Enhancing Surge, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Swift Savage Fortifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Swift, Savage and Fortifying modifiers to Enhancing Surge, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action, increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Resilient Savage

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient and Savage modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage and increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent.
Resilient Fortifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient and Fortifying modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Resilient Swift

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient and Swift modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage and gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action.
Resilient Swift Savage

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient, Swift and Savage modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action and increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent.
Resilient Swift Savage

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient, Swift and Savage modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Resilient Swift Savage Fortifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Resilient, Swift, Savage and Fortifying modifiers to Enhancing Surge, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage, gaining an additional action that can be used to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage or Hide action, increasing the target's next weapon attack by 1d6 per point spent and gaining an additional [1] per point spent.
Empowered Psionics
When you deal damage with a psionic power, your Intelligence modifier is added to the damage dealt.
Psychic Drain
You draw on the psychic energy of another creature to sustain yourself, gaining <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to half of the damage dealt.
Gained [1].
Glimpse the Future
Has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Creature will return to previous hit points when reduced to [1].
Gain [1] and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to being Frightened.
<LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to being Surprised and next attack against this creature with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> no longer has Advantage.
Kinetic Slam
Kinetic Slam
You can use Telekinetic Force as a ranged psionic attack. You can only apply the Hammering modifier when using it in this manner.
Elemental Shield

You gain the ability to cast Fire Shield without expending Psi Points. Once you cast it this way, you canâ€™t cast it again until you finish a Long Rest, unless you spend 4 Psi Points to cast it again.
Elemental Aegis
Surround yourself in a shield of fire, ice or lightning, gaining [1]. Creatures that attack you while this shield is active take [2], [3] or [4], depending on the shield's type.
Elemental Aegis: Fire
Surround yourself in a shield of fire, gaining [1]. Targets that attack you while this shield is active take [2].
Elemental Aegis: Cold
Surround yourself in a shield of ice, gaining [1]. Targets that attack you while this shield is active take [2].
Elemental Aegis: Lightning
Surround yourself in a shield of lightning, gaining [1]. Targets that attack you while this shield is active take [2].
A shield surrounds you made of fire. If attacked while this shield is active, the target takes [1].
A shield surrounds you made of ice. If attacked while this shield is active, the target takes [1].
A shield surrounds you made of lightning. If attacked while this shield is active, the target takes [1].

You gain the ability to surround yourself with a swirling shield of fire, ice, or lightning, granting <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your class level plus your Intelligence modifier. Creatures that strike you while you have these temporary hit points take [1], [2] or [3].
Elemental Emotions
The powers you wield effect your state of mind, empowering you based on how you wield them. When you deal elemental damage, you gain the related mental properties until the start of your next turn.
Elemental Emotions: Fire
Has 1d4 added to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Elemental Emotions: Cold
Has 1d4 added to Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Elemental Emotions: Lightning
Has 1d4 added to Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Mind Devourer
Regain [1] and 1 expended Psi Point when a creature with an Intelligence score above 5 dies within [2] of you.
Restored [1] and gained a Psi Point due to creature death.
Psionic Weapon

As a bonus action, you can expend 1 Psi Point to imbue a weapon you are holding with psionic energy. For 10 turns, once per turn when you deal damage with that weapon, you can deal an extra [1]. At higher levels you can expend additional psi points to further enhance the Psionic Weapon; 2 points to enhance it to [2] at 5th level, 3 points to enhance it to [3] at 11th level and 4 points to enhance it to [4] at 17th level.
Psionically Attuned Weapon
When you use the Psionic Weapon talent, the affected weapon gains a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the number of Psi Points spent, up to a maximum of +3 with three Psi Points spent.
Manifested Emotions
You can manifest your emotions into elemental powers that take physical shape as mephits (ice mephit for cold, magma mephit for fire, and dust mephit for lightning).
Tantrum

Your anger boils just beneath the surface. When you start your turn, you can instantly increase your rampage die by one step. Additionally, if you take damage while your rampage die is a d6 or lower, your rampage die increases by one step. Requires the Telekinesis discipline.
You can focus your telekinetic power, spreading it thin to create a large barrier.
Telekinetic Barrier

Create a telekinetic barrier at a chosen point or surrounding a creature. Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attacks</LSTag> passing through the barrier are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Surrounded by a barrier. Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attacks</LSTag> passing through the barrier are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Fissure

The Fissure spell is added to your Telekinesis Alternate Effects list. Additionally, as a reaction to a melee attack being made against you, you can expend 1 Psi Point to shove the creature away. The creature must make a Strength Saving Throw or be knocked [1] backwards, causing the attack to miss automatically.
Mental Might

You learn to focus your mental grip. You can use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength modifier when you make an Athletics Check. Additionally, you may attempt to grapple or shove a creature within [1] using your mind.
Toggle Mental Might
Use your Intelligence in place of Strength for Athletics Check.
Telekinetic Movement
Gain the ability to increase your Movement Speed and benefit from the effects of Feather Fall.
Telekinetic Weapons
Gain access to the Telekinetic Weapons psionic power. You can use Psionic Mastery points on this power, and this power counts as a discipline power of the Telekinesis Discipline.
Toggle Telekinetic Weapons Options
Toggle to set Telekinetic Weapons to throw weapons at its base range of [1], its short range of [2] or its long range of [3].
Consuming Link

<LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MindLeech">Mind Leech</LSTag> is able to target creatures up to [1] away as long as they are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> by you and they have <LSTag Tooltip="<LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>"><LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag></LSTag> on the <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against the power.
Toggle Surging Power
Automatically cast Enhancing Surge on yourself at the start of your turns.
Surging Power
Allow Enhancing Surge to be used as a bonus action on yourself. When used as a bonus action, Enhancing Surge only adds [1] additional damage to attacks and only grants [1] instead of 1d6 of both.
Enhanced Regrowth

You gain access to the Cure Wounds spell for 1 Psi Point and can cast it at higher levels by spending additional Psi Points. When you cast Cure Wounds on a target, you can use Enhancing Surge on the target as a bonus action.
Toggle on to remove your ability to use Enhancing Surge on a target as a bonus action.

Bestial Spirit
Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Intimidation and Performance <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> or push all creatures within [1] of you [1] away from you.
All creatures within [1] are pushed [1] away from you.
Unshackled Power
Gain the ability to unleash your mind to physically interact with the world around you, granting the psionic discipline Telekinesis.
Overwhelming Power
Gain the ability to cast Thaumaturgy with your psionic powers. When you do so, you gain an additional option to force all targets within [1] to be pushed back [1].
Rampaging Power

Gain a [1] rampage die. Once per turn during your turn when make a damage roll, add this rampage die to the damage roll. If you dealt damage during your last turn, your rampage die increases by one size, up to a [2]. If you did not deal damage during your last turn or become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INCAPACITATED">Incapacitated</LSTag>, it becomes a [1] once more.
Rampage Die
Rampage Die: 1d4
Rampage Die: 1d6
Rampage Die: 1d8
Rampage Die: 1d10
Rampage Die: 1d12
Deal an additional [1] damage once per turn.
Uncontrollable Mind

You gain immunity to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag> as well as effects that would control your mind while your rampage die is a [1] or more.
Unstoppable Rampage

When an attack reduces you to [1], you can make a DC 20 Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>. If you succeed, you can roll your rampage die and regain hit points equal to the result. You can expend 2 psi points to reduce the DC to 15.
Unlocked Potential

Unlock the potential of a creature's mind, pushing it beyond its limitations. Once per turn, the creature can add 1d4 to any <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, Damage Roll or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> but it takes [1].
Unlocked Potential
Once per turn, add [1] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, a Damage Roll or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> but take [2].
Mind Blast
Emit a blast of psychic energy in a cone, possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunning</LSTag> creatures in the area.
Targets still take half damage and aren't <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>.
Psionic Talents allow a psion to further specialize however they wish. You can pick two Psionic Talents at 2nd level and an additional one at 5th, 7th, 9th, 12th, 15th, and 18th level.
Psionic Talents
Replace Psionic Talent
You can replace one of your Psionic Talents with another.

A psionic discipline comes with a passive feature that expands your character's capabilities and an active psionic power that can be modified and empowered with Psi Points. Additionally you can use your discipline in more detailed applications to recreate the effect of certain spells.
Psionic Disciplines

You gain the ability to exert great feats of psionic power. Choose one 6th-level spell, one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level and one 9th-level spell at 17th level from the psion spell list as an innate ability, allowing you to cast it once until you finish a long rest. Unlike psionic disciplines, Innate Psionics spells require any component the spell requires.
Innate Psionics
Innate Psionics: Blade Barrier
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Wall_BladeBarrier">Blade Barrier</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Chain Lightning
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ChainLightning">Chain Lightning</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Disintegrate
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Disintegrate">Disintegrate</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Eyebite
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Eyebite">Eyebite</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Harm
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Harm">Harm</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Mind Blast
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_MindBlast_Psion">Mind Blast</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Teleport
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Teleport_Psion">Teleport</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Regenerate
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Regenerate_Psion">Regenerate</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Dominate Monster
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DominateMonster_Psion">Dominate Monster</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Feeblemind
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Feeblemind_Psion">Feeblemind</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Mind Blank
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MindBlank_Psion">Mind Blank</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Power Word: Stun
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_PowerWordStun_Psion">Power Word: Stun</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Foresight
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Foresight_Psion">Foresight</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Power Word: Kill
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_PowerWordKill_Psion">Power Word: Kill</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
Innate Psionics: Time Stop
You can use the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_TimeStop_Psion">Time Stop</LSTag> spell as an innate ability.
An outfit complete with a vest befitting of a middle class citizen.
Middle Class Garb
A standard gambeson of quilted cloth.
Padded Armour
War Psion
You have Elemental Blast: Force set as the attack you'll use when an enemy provokes an attack of opportunity.
Inner Power

At the end of your turn after spending one or more Psi Points during your turn (not counting temporary or free points, such as those from Psionic Mastery), you heal for a number of hit points equal to the Psi Points spent.
Psionic Mind
You can select a Psionic Talent from the Psion class psionic talent list.
Psionic Adept (Telekinesis)

Gain the Telekinesis Discipline of the Psion class, gaining the attached psionic feature and psionic power. Gain 1 Psi Point that you can use to empower psionic powers. You regain use of this Psi Point when you complete a short or long rest.
Psionic Adept (Telepathy)

Gain the Telepathy Discipline of the Psion class, gaining the attached psionic feature and psionic power. Gain 1 Psi Point that you can use to empower psionic powers. You regain use of this Psi Point when you complete a short or long rest.
Psionic Adept (Enhancement)

Gain the Enhancement Discipline of the Psion class, gaining the attached psionic feature and psionic power. Gain 1 Psi Point that you can use to empower psionic powers. You regain use of this Psi Point when you complete a short or long rest.
Psionic Adept (Psychokinetics)

Gain the Psychokinetics Discipline of the Psion class, gaining the attached psionic feature and psionic power. Gain 1 Psi Point that you can use to empower psionic powers. You regain use of this Psi Point when you complete a short or long rest.
Psionic Adept (Transposition)

Find Familiar: Psi Crystal

Impart your mind into a psi crystal, storing a fragment of your personality into it which can be released by shattering the crystal. Psionic disciplines with a range greater than self can be used through the crystal's position.
While you have a Psi Crystal active, as a bonus action, you can deactivate it to regain 2 expended Psi Points.
Find Familiar: Courage Psi Crystal
Impart your mind into a psi crystal, storing a fragment of your courage into it. Psionic disciplines with a range greater than self can be used through the crystal's position.

When you make a Saving Throw against the Frightened condition, you can use your Reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing the emotion to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on the save.
Find Familiar: Cowardice Psi Crystal
Impart your mind into a psi crystal, storing a fragment of your cowardice into it. Psionic disciplines with a range greater than self can be used through the crystal's position.
When your Psi Crystal is within 9m of you and a creature comes within 2m, you can use your Reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing the emotion to receive the benefits of the Dodge action.
Find Familiar: Cruelty Psi Crystal
Impart your mind into a psi crystal, storing a fragment of your cruelty into it. Psionic disciplines with a range greater than self can be used through the crystal's position.

When your Psi Crystal is within 9m of a creature that takes damage, you can use your Reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing the emotion and causing the creature to take additional damage equal to your psion level.
Find Familiar: Sympathy Psi Crystal
Impart your mind into a psi crystal, storing a fragment of your sympathy into it. Psionic disciplines with a range greater than self can be used through the crystal's position.

When your Psi Crystal is within 9m of you and another creature, if that creature takes damage, you can use your Reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing the emotion and granting the creature <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to that damage but you take an equal amount of damage.

Nourishing Mind Leech

Gain two psionic charges on a failed save until the end of your next turn. You can expend these charges when you deal damage to deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier or consume these charges to gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Shredding Mind Leech

Assault the mind of a creature, rending and devouring its psionic energy to deal [1] and reducing their next Saving Throw by 1d4. If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead.

Assault the mind of a creature, rending and devouring its psionic energy to deal [1], reducing their next Strength, Dexterity or Constitutuon Saving Throw by 1d4 or their next Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma Saving Throw by 2d4. If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead.

Assault the mind of a creature, rending and devouring its psionic energy to deal [1]. If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead. You can also draw a 5th level or lower spell from the target and use Psi Points to cast it.

Devouring Shredding Mind Leech

Assault the mind of surrounding creatures, rending and devouring their psionic energy to deal [1] and reducing their next Strength, Dexterity or Constitutuon Saving Throw by 1d4 or their next Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma Saving Throw by 3d4. If a target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead.
Devouring Thieving Mind Leech

Assault the mind of surrounding creatures, rending and devouring their psionic energy to deal [1]. If a target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead. You can also draw a 5th level or lower spell from targets and use Psi Points to cast it.
Rending Nourishing Shredding Mind Leech

Assault the mind of a creature, rending and devouring its psionic energy to deal [1] and reducing their next Saving Throw by 1d4. If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead.

Gain two psionic charges on a failed save until the end of your next turn. You can expend these charges when you deal damage to deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier or consume these charges to gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead. You can also draw a 5th level or lower spell from the target and use Psi Points to cast it.

Gain two psionic charges on a failed save until the end of your next turn. You can expend these charges when you deal damage to deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier or consume these charges to gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Shredding Nourishing Thieving Rending Mind Leech

Assault the mind of a creature, rending and devouring its psionic energy to deal [1] and reducing their next Strength, Dexterity or Constitutuon Saving Throw by 1d4 or their next Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma Saving Throw by 3d4. If the target is Frightened, Charmed, Stunned, Restrained or Paralyzed, deal [2] instead. You can also draw a 5th level or lower spell from the target and use Psi Points to cast it.

Consumption Discipline

Skill Thief
You can gain an additional number of skill proficiencies from Adaptive Hunter equal to [1].
Unlife Wielder

While you have a psionic charge, you can expend it on a corpse, bringing it to a state of unlife and becoming a zombie. It acts on its own turns. Its unlife fades at the end of your next turn unless you expend a psionic charge or Psi Point on your next turn (no action required) to continue its animation for an additional round. You can spend Psionic Mastery points on this.

Enhancing Surge
Mutate
Manipulate the nature of your body with magic, temporarily giving it new properties. You can select three different properties.
Mutations
Select up to three different proerpties as a result of your mutation. As an action, you may remove all of your chosen mutations to choose different mutations.
Amorphus Body
Your body becomes malleable and amorphous. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on saves against the Restrained condition.
Hardened Flesh
Your flesh hardens, causing your base AC to become 13.
Natural Weapon

You grow a vicious natural weapon from your body. You have proficiency with this weapon. You can use your spellcasting modifier in place of your Strength modifier for attack and damage rolls with this weapon.
Resilience
You grow more resilient, adapting against one external threat. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on one type of saving throw of your choice.
Resilience
You grow more resilient, adapting against one external threat. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on one type of saving throw of your choice.
Resilience: Strength
You grow more resilient, adapting against one external threat. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength saving throws.
Resilience: Dexterity
You grow more resilient, adapting against one external threat. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Dexteity saving throws.

Resilience: Wisdom

Resilience: Charisma

Enlarge/Reduce (Effect)
You gain the Enlarge effects of the Enlarge/Reduce spell.
Mutation Removal
Remove all of the chosen mutation properties applied to you and choose new properties.
Tranquil Meditation
You and allied creatures in the area regain hit points equal to the number of hit die you expend + your Intelligence modifier.
Physical Surge (Strength)
Your Strength is equal to your Intelligence until the start of your next turn after using Enhancing Surge on yourself.
Physical Surge (Dexterity)
Your Dexterity is equal to your Intelligence until the start of your next turn after using Enhancing Surge on yourself.
Body Control
Gain the ability to use Alter Self at-will without expending Psi Points. Additionally, you can cast Enlarge/Reduce on yourself for 1 Psi Point instead of 2.
Metamorphosis
The Mutate and Polymorph spells are added to your Enhancement Alternate Effects list. Requires the Enhancement discipline and the Body Control psionic talent.
Physical Surge
When you use Enhancing Surge targeting yourself, toggle to set your Strength or Dexterity equal to your Intelligence until the start of your next turn.
Transcendent Life
The Mass Cure Wounds and Reincarnate spells are added to your Enhancement Alternate Effects list.
Invest Life
Sacrifice some of your health to mend another creature. You take 4d8 damage and the target creature regains hit points equal to twice the amount of damage you took.
Propelled Bound
Make a single bounding leap, propelled by telekinetic power or psychokinetic force.
Physical Telekinesis

After applying the Enhancing Surge ability to the target, grant the target the ability to move 3m without provoking attacks of opportunity, provide disadvantage against weapon attacks against them or provide <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> to their Athletics checks and weapon attacks for 1 turn. Addiitonally, you may Telekinetic Force modifiers may be applied to your weapon attacks.
Physical Telekinesis (Movement)
Gain the ability to move 3m without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Physical Telekinesis (<LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>)
Telekinetically deflect weapon attacks, granting disadvantage against them.
Physical Telekinesis (<LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>)
Telekinetically boost the Atheletics checks and weapon attacks, granting <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> with them.
Kinetic Mastery
Allow Telekinetic Force modifiers to apply to Elemental Blast and Elemental Blast modifiers to apply to Telekinetic Force.
Empowered Strike

Once per turn, as part of making a weapon attack as part of the attack action, you can empower a melee weapon you are holding with psionic power. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can apply Elemental Blast or Telekinetic Force modifiers to the attack. This does not deal the base damage of the power, but any added damage causes the additional effects of the power damage effects to occur.
Life Wielder
You learn the spell Invest Life. You can spend Psionic Mastery points to cast this spell.
Propelled Bound
Gain access to the Propelled Bound spell. When you move on your turn, you can expend movement up to your speed, in single bounding leap, propelled by telekinetic power or psychokinetic force.
Movement
You gain the ability to move 3m without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Movement
You telekinetically deflect weapon attacks made against you, granting the attacker <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Movement
You telekinetically boost your athletics checks and weapon attacks, gaining <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> with them.
Physical Telekinesis

When you use a Enhancing Surge to empower a creature, you can expend a Psi Point to grant one of the following benefits: move the creature 3m which doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, grant disadvantage against weapon attacks against it, or grant <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> to their Athletics checks and next weapon attack. Addititionally, you can apply Telekinetic Force modifiers to your weapon attacks. Requires the Telekinesis discipline, Enhancement and the Psionic Synthesis Feat.
Kinetic Mastery

Your ability to manipulate energy becomes a single blended prowess, freely swapping between manipulating force and energy. You can apply Telekinetic Force modifiers to Elemental Blast and Elemental Blast modifiers to Telekinetic Force.
Elemental Phasing

As you step between planes, you can tap into the Elemental Planes, bringing their power into the material with you. You can use Psychokinetics modifiers on Phase Rift (excluding Massive). Additionally, whenever you deal damage to an area with a Psychokinetics ability that would include yourself, you can phase yourself out of reality taking no damage from the effect.
Parasitic Nightmare

Gain the ability to add Telepathic Intrusion modifiers to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MindLeech">Mind Leech</LSTag>. Additionally, when you deal psychic damage to a creature that is frightened of you, you can render yourself invisible to that creature until the start of your next turn. If you are hidden from a creature that is of you Frightened, when it moves, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 1.5m of that creature at the completion of their turn.
Element Eater

Your mind is merged with your elemental power, and it is life and sustainence for you, integrating with your powers of consumption, granting you benefits. You can use the Living Power modifier Shaped Power to turn <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MindLeech">Mind Leech</LSTag> into a melee or ranged spell attack, as per those modifiers; you cannot add any modifier that requires the target to fail a saving throw when using it this way.
Nullification Discipline

You delve into the systematic study of psionics, allowing you to select one from the Psion class to begin your studies. The psionic power of the Discipline becomes a 1st level spell for you. Secondary Power

The power of psionics you study seep into your mind. You can tap this power to use one psionic power spell gained from the Study of the Unknown feature to cast it without expending a spell slot but as if you had spent a spell slot equal to half your Wizard level (rounded up). You cannot use this feature again until you complete a long rest or use your Arcane Recovery Feature.
Secondary Power

The power of psionics you study seep into your mind. You can tap this power to use one psionic power spell gained from the Study of the Unknown feature to cast it without expending a spell slot but as if you had spent a spell slot equal to half your Wizard level (rounded up). You cannot use this feature again until you complete a long rest or use your Arcane Recovery Feature.
Branching Studies
You can study a second psionic Discipline.
Blind Spot
You gain the ability to lurk in the mental blind spots of creatures. When you take the Hide action, you can hide from creatures even if you have no cover from them.
Telepathic Sneak Attack

You gain the Telepathic Intrusion psionic power of the Telepathy discipline. If you are hidden from the target, you can apply your Sneak attack dice to the damage dealt or add additional psi points to the power equal to half the amount of Sneak Attack dice you have (rounded up, minimum 1). This counts as dealing Sneak Attack damage.
Telepathic Sneak Attack

You gain the Telepathic Intrusion psionic power of the Telepathy discipline. If you are hidden from the target, you can apply your Sneak attack dice to the damage dealt or add additional psi points to the power equal to half the amount of Sneak Attack dice you have (rounded up, minimum 1). This counts as dealing Sneak Attack damage.

Astral Construct (Modifiers)
Expend spell slots to apply modifiers to Astral Construct.
Commands
You may issue commands to the Astral Construct and empower it.
Solidify
Your construct becomes solid. It has an AC of 16, and hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + Level. The construct becomes ethereal again if it drops to zero hit points.
Strike
Your construct may perform an attack even if it has already performed an attack.
Relocate
Your construct may gain the ability to disappear and reappear anywhere within 18m.
Grab

Can only be used while your construct is Solidified. A target creature within 1.5m of your construct must make a Strength saving throw or be Restrained. At the end of the creatures turns it can repeat the saving throw. The condition ends of the construct becomes ethereal again.
Grow

Your construct increases by a size, and its damage increases by one die. It can only gain one additional die. If applied a weapon through the Projected Weaponry psionic talent, the weapon deals an additional [1].
Replicate
Until the end of the turn, you have another astral construct and control both with the same action (commands only affect one of your choice).

Project an ethereal creation with a humanoid shape that you mentally control.
When the Astral Construct is created and as an Action on your following turns, you can Command it to attack a creature within [1] of it, dealing [2].
Command
Command your Astral Constructs to attack a creature within [1] of them, dealing [2].
If a creature is within the Astral Constructs' Movement range, they automatically move to the creature and attack it instead.
Command your Astral Construct to attack a creature within [1] of it, dealing [2].

Command your replicated Astral Construct to attack a creature within [1] of it, dealing [2].

Unarmed Attack
Unarmed Attack
Commands
Spend Psi Points to issue commands to the Astral Construct and empower it.
Solidify
The Astral Construct becomes solid, gaining 16 AC and [1].
The construct becomes ethereal again if it drops to [1].
Strike
The Astral Construct can attack again, even if it has already attacked.
Relocate
The Astral Construct disappears and reappears within [1] of you.
Grab
The Astral Construct gains the ability to reach for a creature and Restrain them.
This command may only be used while the Astral Construct is Solidified and its effect ends if the construct is no longer Solidified.
Grab
Reach for a creature, causing it to be Restrained.
The creature repeats the Saving Throw at the end of their turns, with a successful save ending the effect.
Grow
The Astral Construct increases in size and its damage increases by one die, up to [1].
Grow: Projected Weaponry
A weapon created by the Projected Weaponry talent increases its size and it deals an additional [1].
Must be equipped with a weapon created through the Projected Weaponry talent.
Replicate
Replicate your construct and control both with the same action (Commands only affect one of your choice). The replicate must be Sustained or it disappears at the end of its turn.
Replicated Astral Constructs also receive the Grow and Solidify Commands.
Sustain
Sustain the effect of Replicate for an additional turn on the replicated Astral Construct.

Projection Discipline

Gain access to the Projection discipline abilities: passive feature, Project Item, allows the creation of ethereal weapons that deal force damage, the psionic power, Astral Construct and associated spells if you do not gain the discipline through the Psionic Adept feat.

Astral Swap
Swap places with your astral construct.
Life Link
Has <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> against all damage.
Astral Swap
As a bonus action, you may expend 1 Psi Point to swap places with your Astral Construct.
Life Link
Gain the ability to take the damage a solidified Astral Construct would take. You have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to the damage taken.
Matter Made Real
You gain the ability to solidify some of your projections into real objects. You can cast Wall of Stone by expending Psi Soints equal to the spell level.
Projected Weaponry

When you project a weapon with your Project Item feature, it gains the following benefits: you can project it as a bonus action and you can project up 3 weapons at the same time, you are proficient with any projected weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with it, and you can apply the Astral Construct modifiers Grow and Sustain, which Psionic Mastery can be used for.
Unlimited Imagination
When you manifest a construct, you can select an additional option from Boundless Imagination.
Life Link
Take half of the damage dealt to a solidified Astral Construct.
Shared_Status_BOOST_DIPPED_FIRE_SWITCH_DisplayName
Specialization
Pick an elemental specialization between fire, cold and lightning or remain generalized.
General
Choose to remain generalized for the Psychokinetics discipline.
Fire Specialization
Choose to become specialized in the Fire element for the Psychokinetics discipline.
When chosen, your Alternate Effects is changed to all Fire-based spells and you may only deal Fire damage with Elemental Blast and its modifiers.
Cold Specialization
Choose to become specialized in the Cold element for the Psychokinetics discipline.
When chosen, your Alternate Effects is changed to all Cold-based spells and you may only deal Cold damage with Elemental Blast and its modifiers.
Lightning Specialization
Choose to become specialized in the Lightning element for the Psychokinetics discipline.
When chosen, your Alternate Effects is changed to all Lightning and Thunder-based spells and you may only deal Lightning damage with Elemental Blast and its modifiers.

Spatial Manipulation

Your mind grows a greater perspective on the nature of space and dimensions, allowing you to manipulate it and your relation to it, granting you the psionic discipline of Transposition. Additionally, your connection to your transdimensional powers are such that you can slide through the spaces you see in dimensions as another might slip through a tight space, without conscious thought or effort. You can use your Dexterity ability score in place of your Intelligence ability score calculating the DC or Attack Roll modifier of Transpositional powers, alternate effects, or talents that require the Transpositional discipline.

Movement is 0 and gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage except fire and force.
Full Manifestation: Lightning
Gain the ability to teleport up to your Movement Speed.
Elemental Form: Fire Elemental
Elemental Form: Water Elemental
Elemental Form: Air Elemental
Elemental Power
Gain a deep intrinsic tie to elemental power, granting you the ability to manipulate it. Gain the psionic discipline of Psychokinetics.
Primordial Aspect
As an action or when you deal Fire, Cold or Lightning damage, you take on an aspect of that element until the end of your next turn or you take on a new primordial aspect.
Living Power

Your powers become a living extension of your mind, weaving an extension of your will into reality. When you use a power or alternate effect of Psychokinetics, you can apply the Shaped Power, Controlled Power or Raging Power modifiers.
Living Power
Toggle on and off to set your Living Power to Shaped, Controlled or Raging.
Full Manifestation

If you are not in a primordial aspect, you can fully manifest an element as a bonus action for 2 Psi Points (or 1 Psi Point if you are specialized in that power). When you enter a primordial aspect, you can expend 1 Psi Point to fully manifest that element, replacing the primordial aspect with the effect. If you are specialized in that element, it doesnâ€™t require a Psi Point to fully manifest the power.
Elemental Form

You can expend 5 Psi Points to cast Shapechange to assume elemental forms. When you cast Shapechange in this way, it has no verbal or material components, but you can only assume the form of a Water Elemental, Fire Elemental, or Air Elemental. If you are specialized in an element, the cost is reduced to 3 Psi Points but you can only assume the form associated with your specialization.
Elemental Penetration
Elemental Penetration
Vulnerable to Fire damage.
Elemental Penetration
Vulnerable to Cold damage.
Elemental Penetration
Vulnerable to Lightning damage.
Elemental Penetration
Gain the ability to cause enemies to gain vulnerability against your psionic powers or spells that deal Fire, Cold or Lightning damage. Requires the Psychokinetics discipline.
Psionics
Use the ability of psionics granted through the tadpole.
Gravity Sphere
Create a sphere of intensified gravity around you, causing the area to be treated as difficult terrain for creatures of your choice within it.
Psychic Persuasion
Manipulate the minds of hostile creatures to appear to them as an ally temporarily.
The power ends early if you attack or cast a spell.
Planar Exchange
Travel through space and exchange positions with another infected creature.
Projected Armor

Surround yourself in projected, ethereal shield from your imagination, granting <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to bludgeoning, slashing, piercing and force damage the next time you take damage.
Siphoned Power
Siphon magical or psionic energies from a creature and gain certain effects applied to them granted by spells, powers and abilities.
These siphoned effects last for 3 rounds.
Psychofeedback
Forcibly transform your body to become more resilient, increasing your AC by 1 and becoming immune to environmental surface effects.
Kinetic Susceptivity
Infuse elemental energies into a creature through psychokinesis, causing them to gain negative effects when they take fire, cold or lightning damage.

If the target takes fire damage, they cannot regain Hit Points. If the target takes cold damage, they have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on their weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. If the target takes lightning damage, they cannot take Reactions.
Prescient Reflex
Receive fleetings vision of the future, causing the next attack of opportunity against you to automatically miss.
When an opportunity attack misses you, you perform a melee weapon attack against the attacker.
Gravity Sphere
Hostile creatures within [1] are treated as being in difficult terrain.
Projected Shield
Gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESISTANCE">Resistance</LSTag> to bludgeoning, slashing, piercing and force damage.
Siphoned Power
A magical or psionic benefit was siphoned away from you.
Psychofeedback
Become resilient, gaining +1 to your AC and immunity to environmental surface effects.
Kinetic Susceptivity
Suffer negative effects when you take fire, cold or lightning damage.
Kinetic Susceptivity: Fire
Cannot regain Hit Points.
Kinetic Susceptivity: Cold
Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on weapon <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Kinetic Susceptivity: Lightning
Cannot take Reactions.
Prescient Reflexes
The next attack of opportunity against you automatically misses and you perform a weapon attack against the attacker in turn.
Psychic Perusasion
Enemies around you believe you are their ally, preventing them from attack you unless you attack them or perform a spell.

Hammering Kinetic Slam
Telekinesis Discipline

Gain access to the Telekinesis discipline abilities: passive feature, Telekinetic Hand, allowing you to manipulate objects in the area, the psionic power, Telekinetic Force and associated spells if you do not gain the discipline through the Psionic Adept feat.
Telekinetic Force Options
Toggle on and off to set Telekinetic Force to push the target backwards, pull the target forwards or knocking the target prone.

Mental Might
Grapple a creature using your mind.
Grappling depends on your Athletics, and the higher of the target's Athletics or Acrobatics skill.
Telekinetic Movement
Use telekinesis to gain an additional [1] of Movement Speed and the effects of Feather Fall.
Telekinetic Weapons (Modifiers)
Spend Psi Points to apply modifiers to Telekinetic Weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional weapon.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional two weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional three weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional four weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional five weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional six weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional seven weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional eight weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional nine weapons.
Multiple
Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional ten weapons.
Whirling
Expend Psi Points to add the Whilring modifier to Telekinetic Weapons, replacing a thrown weapon with a casting of Cloud of Daggers with a spell level equal to the number of psi points spent.
Multiple Whirling

Expend Psi Points to add the Multiple and Whilring modifiers to Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to throw an additional weapon per point spent and replace a thrown weapon with a casting of Cloud of Daggers equal to the number of psi points spent.
Telekinetic Weapons
Telekinetically fling a weapon within range or a weapon under your control at a creature or object. The target takes damage equal to the weapon's damage dice.
Only weapons without the light or heavy properties may be thrown.

Telekinetic Movement
Movement is increased by [1] and under the effects of Feather Fall.
Telekinetic Weapons: Base

Telepathic Communication
Communicate telepathically with a chosen creature.

While communicating telepathically, both creatures have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll"><LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag></LSTag> and Saving Throws that would include either in the attack's area of effect or radius.
Telepathic Intrusion

Assault the mind of a creature, dealing [1] and causing the target to have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll"><LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag></LSTag> made against you.
Mind Reader
Telepathic Intrusion (Modifiers)
Expend Psi Points to apply modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion.
Rending
Expend Psi Points to add the Rending modifier to Telepathic Intrusion, increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Terrifying
Expend Psi Points to add the Terrifying modifier to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to become Frightened of you.
Meddling
Expend Psi Points to add the Meddling modifier to Telepathic Intrusion, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target.
Rending Terrifying
Expend Psi Points to add the Rending and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent and causing the target to become Frightened of you.
Overwhelming
Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming modifier to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned.
Meddling Rending

Expend Psi Points to add the Meddling and Rending modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target and increasing its damage by an additioanl [1] per point spent.
Meddling Terrifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Meddling and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target and causing the target to become Frightened of you.
Overwhelming Rending
Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming and Rending modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Overwhelming Terrifying
Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and Frightened of you.
Meddling Rending Terrifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Meddling, Rending and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target, increasing its damage by an additioanl [1] per point spent and causing the target to be Frightened of you.
Overwhelming Rending Terrifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming, Rending and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and Frightened of you and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Overwhelming Meddling

Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming and Meddling modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target.
Overwhelming Meddling Rending

Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming, Meddling and Rending modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.
Overwhelming Meddling Terrifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming, Meddling and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and Frightened of you and causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target
Overwhelming Meddling Rending Terrifying

Expend Psi Points to add the Overwhelming, Meddling, Rending and Terrifying modifiers to Telepathic Intrusion, causing the target to be Stunned and Frightened of you, causing you to become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> to the target and increasing its damage by an additional [1] per point spent.

When a creature deals damage to you, you can spend expend 1 or more Psi Points (up to your Psi Point Limit) to share the pain you experienced back at them, dealing 1d10 Psychic Damage per point spent. The damage this deals cannot exceed the damage taken from the attack.
Tactical Opening

You can communicate the opening of a creature to your allies. When you take the Help action in this way, its range becomes [1].

After using Phase Rift, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + the Psi Points spent on the power.
Phase Slash

You can expend 1 Psi Point to make a single weapon attack against any target you pass through with Phase Rift as part of the same action. You can make this attack against a target once per turn. You can spend Psionic Mastery points on this talent.
